class.rdfs:comment: Any part of the human body, typically a component of an anatomical system. Organs, tissues, and cells are all anatomical structures.
class.rdfs:label: AnatomicalStructure

schema:associatedPathophysiology.rdfs:comment: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.
schema:associatedPathophysiology.rdfs:label: associatedPathophysiology

schema:bodyLocation.rdfs:comment: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.
schema:bodyLocation.rdfs:label: bodyLocation

schema:connectedTo.rdfs:comment: Other anatomical structures to which this structure is connected.
schema:connectedTo.rdfs:label: connectedTo

schema:diagram.rdfs:comment: An image containing a diagram that illustrates the structure and/or its component substructures and/or connections with other structures.
schema:diagram.rdfs:label: diagram

schema:partOfSystem.rdfs:comment: The anatomical or organ system that this structure is part of.
schema:partOfSystem.rdfs:label: partOfSystem

schema:relatedCondition.rdfs:comment: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.
schema:relatedCondition.rdfs:label: relatedCondition

schema:relatedTherapy.rdfs:comment: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.
schema:relatedTherapy.rdfs:label: relatedTherapy

schema:subStructure.rdfs:comment: Component (sub-)structure(s) that comprise this anatomical structure.
schema:subStructure.rdfs:label: subStructure
